docs.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, he was New York’s mightiest labor leader. Now he has emerged as a central player in the effort to save President Obama’s health care effort.

docs.lead_paragraph: A big part of Senator Edward Kennedy's legacy is his years of work for genuine health care reform. I can think of no better tribute to Senator Kennedy's memory then for American lawmakers to finally make his dream a reality.

docs.lead_paragraph: Senator Kennedy, a man who knew acclaim and tragedy in near-equal measure, will be remembered as one of the most effective lawmakers in the history of the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Think of them as summer previews for the attack advertisements of the fall. A liberal group has started running low-budget local television advertisements attacking Republicans and the insurance industry as a prelude to more robust national campaigns in September.
docs.abstract: Americans United for Change, liberal group financed by two large labor unions, has started running low-budget television commercials attacking Republicans and insurance industry because of their opposition to health care reform; ads are prelude to more robust national campaigns planned for September; photos (S)
docs.snippet: Think of them as summer previews for the attack advertisements of the fall.      A liberal  group has started running low-budget local television advertisements attacking Republicans and the  insurance industry as a prelude to more robust national...

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 2,500 people jammed into a high school gymnasium in Reston, Va., on Tuesday night for a forum on health care held by Representative James P. Moran, the Democrat who represents the area. At his side was Howard Dean, the former chairman of the Democratic National Committee and an advocate of a government-run health insurance plan. Mr. Dean seemed to be the lightning rod for the event, fielding an array of questions, sometimes angry ones, about health legislation. Among those more intent on yelling slogans than on asking questions was Randall Terry, the anti-abortion advocate and founder of Operation Rescue, who chanted as Mr. Dean, formerly a practicing physician, tried to speak.
docs.abstract: More than 2,500 people jam into high school gymnasium in Reston, Va, for health-care forum led by Rep James P Morgan; attendees include anti-abortion activist Randall Terry; photo (S)
